title: Lula puts forward three new names for Petrobras board
description:
In a securities filing, Brazilian oil giant Petrobras said it had received eight nominations from the federal government for the company’s new board of directors — three of which do not sit on the existing board. The government, Petrobras’s controlling shareholder, holds six of its 11 board seats. The eight names will be assessed and […]

The post Lula puts forward three new names for Petrobras board appeared first on The Brazilian Report.

title: São Paulo mayor to step up Enel complaints after 60-hour blackout
description:
São Paulo mayor Ricardo Nunes vowed Thursday to file new complaints against Enel, the Italian multinational in charge of power distribution in São Paulo state, after a new blackout in the central part of Brazil’s largest city lasted more than 60 hours. “City Hall is outraged by Enel’s lack of respect for the people of […]

The post São Paulo mayor to step up Enel complaints after 60-hour blackout appeared first on The Brazilian Report.
